heart.startup.title: Heart - The City Beneath (v{VERSION})
heart.startup.description:
Welcome to Heart v{VERSION}

A Quick Intro

Players: you can make rolls from Chat when requested, or directly from your character sheet. Your GM will provide you with class/callings which you can drag & drop onto your sheet.

GMs: the 'Prepare Rollout Request' macro will help your players make rolls more easily. You'll need to create classes and callings for your players by hand, but it should be more or less intuitive how to do this.
heart.clear-stress.title: Tira stress
heart.clear-stress.description: Pick a resistance to set to 0 stress
heart.prepare-fallout-roll.description: Scegli un personaggio con cui tirare complicazione.
heart.prepare-fallout-roll.title: Richiedi un tiro di complicazione
heart.prepare-roll-request.description: Scegli la difficoltà, quali personaggi possono tirare e aiutare, e quali abilità e domini possono usare. Poi manda un messaggio in chat con la richiesta.
heart.prepare-roll-request.title: Richiedi un tiro
heart.prepare-roll.title: Prepara un tiro
heart.prepare-roll.description: Scegli la difficoltà, il personaggio con cui tirare e i vari modificatori, poi tira.
heart.prepare-stress-roll.title: Prepara un tiro di stress
heart.prepare-stress-roll.description: Scegli un personaggio, il tipo di risultato, la taglia del dado e la resistenza con cui tirare.
heart.take-stress.title: Prendi stress
heart.take-stress.description: Scegli la resistenza su cui prendere stress.
heart.inactive-items-description: Qui troverai gli oggetti aggiunti alla scheda del luogo, ma marcati come inattivi.
heart.name: Nome
heart.questions-prompt: Quando crei il personaggio, rispondi a queste domande:

tag.awkward.name: Scomodo
tag.awkward.description: La risorsa è pesante o difficile da trasportare.
tag.beacon.name: Faro
tag.beacon.description: La risorsa attrae qualcosa di pericoloso verso la sua posizione.
tag.block.name: Blocco
tag.bloodbound.name: Legame di sangue
tag.bloodbound.description: Subisci D4 Stress su Sangue per lanciare con Maestria quando usi questo oggetto per il resto della scena.
tag.brutal.name: Brutale
tag.brutal.description: Quando lanci per infliggere Stress contro un avversario con questo oggetto, lancia due dadi e scegli il risultato più alto. Gli Attributi Brutale sono cumulabili: se hai tre Attributi Brutale, ad esempio, lancerai quattro dadi e sceglierai il più alto per determinare quanto Stress infliggi.
tag.conduit.name: Tramite
tag.conduit.description: Subisci D4 Stress su Mente per lanciare con Maestria quando usi questo oggetto per il resto della scena.
tag.dangerous.name: Pericoloso
tag.dangerous.description: Quando infliggi Stresscon questo oggetto e ottieni il risultato massimo, subisci D6 Stress su Sangue.
tag.debilitating.name: Debilitante
tag.debilitating.description: Una volta per scena, quando infliggi Stress con questo oggetto a uno o più bersagli, nel tuo prossimo attacco effettuato contro di loro lancia con Maestria.
tag.degenerating.name: Degenerante
tag.degenerating.description: Se subisci danni daun’arma con questo Attributo, alla fine della scena fai una prova di Resistere +[Dominio]. Se fallisci, subisci D6 Stress; se ottieni un successo condizionato, subisci D4 Stress; se hai successo, non subisci Stress.
tag.deteriorating.name: Deteriorato
tag.deteriorating.description: La risorsa sta marcendo, arrugginendo o sta per rompersi. Devi trovare quanto prima un nuovo proprietario a cui piazzarla.
tag.distressing.name: Angoscia
tag.distressing.description: Quando infliggi Stress conquesto oggetto e ottieni il risultato massimo,subisci D6 Stress su Mente.
tag.double_barreled.name: Doppia canna
tag.double_barreled.description: Funziona come Ricarica, ma puoi usare l’oggetto due volte prima di ricaricare.
tag.expensive.name: Costoso
tag.expensive.description: Quando infliggi Stress con questo oggetto e ottieni il risultato massimo, subisci D6 Stress su Risorse.
tag.extreme_range.name: A lunga distanza
tag.extreme_range.description: Questo oggetto può essere usato da una lunga distanza.
tag.fragile.name: Fragile
tag.fragile.description: La risorsa viene distrutta se cade o subisce un colpo.
tag.harmful.name: Nocivo
tag.harmful.description: La risorsa ha la capacità di danneggiare coloroche la trasportano tramite magia nera, malattie o strane energie.
tag.limited(X).name: Limite ${X}
tag.limited(X).description: Puoi usare questo oggetto ${X} volte prima che si esaurisca o diventi inutilizzabile.
tag.loud.name: Rumoroso
tag.loud.description: Quando infliggi Stress con questo oggetto e ottieni il risultato massimo, subisci D6 Stress su Fortuna.
tag.mobile.name: Mobile
tag.mobile.description: La risorsa si allontanerà di sua volontà, se lasciata incustodita.
tag.niche.name: Nicchia
tag.niche.description: La risorsa è preziosa solo per un gruppo di persone molto selezionato.
tag.obscuring.name: Oscurante
tag.obscuring.description: Il portatore dell’oggetto e tutti i suoi compagni vicini riducono di un livello il dado dello Stress del danno inflitto o ricevuto da armi a distanza.
tag.one_shot.name: Colpo singolo
tag.one_shot.description: Questo oggetto richiede molto tempo per la sua preparazione o ricarica, quindi puoi usarlo solo una volta per scena.
tag.piercing.name: Perforante
tag.piercing.description: Lo Stress inflitto da questo equipaggiamento non può essere ridotto usando Protezioni su Sangue e neanche i nemici possono utilizzare il loro valore di Protezione.
tag.point_blank.name: Bruciapelo
tag.point_blank.description: Funziona come A Distanza, ma se usato a distanza molto ravvicinata aumenta di un livello il dado dello Stress. Se il colpo sparato da questo oggetto va troppo lontano e inizia a indebolirsi, riduci invece di un livello il dado dello Stress.
tag.potent.name: Potente
tag.potent.description: Quando lanci per rimuovere Stress da te stesso o da un compagno utilizzando questo oggetto, lancia due dadi e scegli il risultato più alto. Gli Attributi Potente sono cumulabili, come avviene con gli Attributi Brutale.
tag.ranged.name: A distanza
tag.ranged.description: Questo oggetto può essereutilizzato a distanza.
tag.reload.name: Ricarica
tag.reload.description: Questo equipaggiamento deve essere ricaricato tra un uso e l’altro, dando ai nemici la possibilità di avvicinarsi fuggire.
tag.smoke.name: Fumante
tag.smoke.description: Funziona come l’Attributo Oscurante, ma solo quando l’oggetto viene utilizzato e solo nell’area in cui è stato utilizzato.
tag.spread.name: Danno diffuso
tag.spread.description: Chiunque si trovi vicino al bersaglio dell’oggetto con questoAttributo, deve superare una prova di Sfuggire + [Dominio] (o usare un’altra Abilità adeguata invece di Sfuggire) per evitare di subire Stress. In caso di successo condizionato, il dado dello Stress ricevuto si riduce di un livello. I PNG coinvolti subiscono sempre lo Stress.
tag.taboo.name: Tabù
tag.taboo.description: La risorsa non è accettata per il baratto nella maggiorparte dei covi (ad esempio organi di persone Sanguedi Cuore, denti d’oro o determinati narcotici).
tag.tiring.name: Stancante
tag.tiring.description: Quando fallisci un’azione usando questo quipaggiamento, il dado dello Stress inflitto o curato da questo oggetto si riduce di un livello per il resto della scena.
tag.trusty.name: Affidabile
tag.trusty.description: Quando lanci per infliggere Stress su una Spedizione, lancia due dadi e scegli il risultato più alto. Gli Attributi Affidabile sono cumulabili, come avviene con gli Attributi Brutale.
tag.unreliable.name: Inaffidabile
tag.unreliable.description: Quando fallisci un’azioneutilizzando questo oggetto, essonon può essere più utilizzato per il restodella scena se ti trovi in un Luogo Noto o per il resto del viaggio se ti trovi in una Spedizione.
tag.volatile.name: Volatile
tag.volatile.description: La risorsa può esplodere, distruggersi o diventareinutilizzabile se tenuta senza cura.
tag.wyrd.name: Fato
tag.wyrd.description: Quando infliggi Stress con questooggetto e ottieni il risultato massimo,subisci D6 Stress su Eco.

changes: Update to work with foundry v10 (thanks to whitespine)

bug_fixes: Wigginns - Heretic staff now named staff as intended.
changes: Added Resistance types to Mend and Kill Equipment. Now you can mark which stress type a weapon deals or can mend.
You can now shift-click an equipment to increase the die by one step when rolling with a critical success or other modifier.
Option to display Total Stress on character sheet.
Option to display an editable field beside each Resistance that can be edited if you don't like ticking boxes.
Added a Tag icon to help distinguish Equipment and Resource tags.
Updated the default icon for Landmarks.
notes: Existing equipment will not have any Resistances associated with them.

changes: Added option to select stress type at the same time as selecting stress size for all stress rolls.
Added propeties to delves including Resistance, maxResistance, Domains, Tier, Resources, Equipment, Connections, and notes.
Added N/A as default choice for rolling stress from character sheet for the instances where you roll stress from fallout or other non-roll result reasons. This is functionally the same as 'failure'
You can now alt-click an equipment roll to decrease the die by one step when rolling with a critical success or other modifier.
notes: Updated the listeners on actors to be located on the base actor for less repetition of code

bug_fixes: Use await for delete, confirm item group deletions
changes: Strikethrough completed beats on calling sheet.
Show beat level on character sheet
Allow editing beat level on beat sheet
Add button to clear stress after suffering fallout
Ability to edit Fallout Level and Resistance from Fallout item
Added italian translations
notes: Thanks to Arcadio21 for providing the italian translations.

bug_fixes: Italian transaction fixes, typo correction, translation for objects attributes
Fix warnings about using deprecated "name" instead of "id"
Fix problem with loading compendium entries that have been translated
Fix dragged compendium items not being having their names translated
changes: Dragging compendium items will now result in an immediately translated name

bug_fixes: Dragging compendium items will no longer accidentally create a duplicate
It is once again possible to open items directly from the compendium
Fixed updates to children of items not triggering a remote re-render

changes: Added an option to ignore protection on stress rolls.
Users can now click tags and view tag description from preview on character sheet.
Buttons on top of sheet size more consistently so you don't end up with one long button.

human.question.1: You were kicked out of a retro-engineering or magical college thanks to your unorthodox beliefs and practices. What did you do?
human.question.0: You are from the Eastern Kingdoms. You came to Spire with nothing but the clothes on your back and a dream, looking for excitement and profit. What went wrong?
human.name: Human
human.description: In this part of the world, humans have a reputation for digging into the ground to uncover ancient relics, and it’s not entirely inaccurate. They have emerged from their scattered island nations in the Eastern Kingdoms bearing retro-engineered technology, and are eager to sell it to the highest bidder. Humans live brief but bright lives in the eyes of the elves, passing away at 60 or so, often from illness or injury. The discovery of spireblack processing and the resulting rise in arms manufacture is almost entirely their doing. They have become prominent enough to gain a seat at the Council that rules the City Above through their shrewd politics, the vast sums gained from their discoveries and the way that they will do anything if the price is right.
human.question.2: You're third-generation Heartborn, and not at all like the humans on the surface. What incorrect assumption do people most often make about you?

drow.name: Drow
drow.description: Monochromatic elves with a strong sensitivity to sunlight. The lands surrounding the Heart are predominantly populated by dark elves, including the towering city of Spire (where they are subjugated by the aelfir) and the rolling desert caravan city of Aliquam. Drow live to around a hundred years of age, but the cruel conditions of Spire means that few of them reach 50. Drow do not give birth to viable young – instead, they lay fist-sized fleshy eggs that must be tended to for months until they develop into an infant. Drow regularly find their way into the Heart, either actively fleeing Spire or trying to find someone or something to call their own in the depths. Some are pilgrims tracing fragmented maps to find the Moon Beneath, tired of the state-mandated religions in Spire. The Drow of Spire predominantly worship Our Glorious Lady, a facet of their on ce-tripartite moon goddess; venerating the other two facets is forbidden. This religion focuses on six primary virtues, and it is considered good and proper for a drow to live their life in accordance with them: Community, Sagacity, Fury, Grace, Tenacity and Vigilance.
drow.question.0: You were born in the City Above and served a durance – four years of indentured servitude – under the rule of the cruel aelfir. What were you forced to do?
drow.question.1: You were born in the City Beneath. Where does your family live, and who or what do they worship?
drow.question.2: You're a traveller from a distant land – the desert of Aliquam, the treacherous foothills of Nujab or the warrenous Home Nations. Where are you from, and why aren't you there anymore?

aelfir.name: Aelfir
aelfir.description: Aelfir benefit from massive privilege; they rule the City Above and lead lives of bizarre luxury in their frozen palace of Amaranth. Some turn away from a life of power to seek meaning in the lawless city below, while others pursue the dark secrets whispered about in perfumed boudoirs. They are tall,impossibly graceful and can sustain their lives supposedly indefinitely with curious rituals and surgeries. Aelfir in the City Above wear masks to hide their faces from their inferiors; in the City Beneath, only traditionalists wear them. In the City Above, their rule is cruel and capricious; it is self-serving and deleterious to those aroundthem.WhenventuringintotheCityBelow, most aelfir know that they lost any authority as soon as they passed through Derelictus. Many have adjusted to their new place in life. It's foolish not to; the Heart treats everyone equally.
aelfir.question.0: You still wear your mask. What does it look like, and why do you wear it?
aelfir.question.1: Your family name was ruined due to a cataclysmic social faux pas. What did they do?
aelfir.question.2: You still cling to one luxury that keeps you centred – a habit, a style of clothing, a drug, etc. What is it?

gnoll.name: Gnoll
gnoll.description: Hyena-headed people from the south with fur that covers their bodies. The gnolls are at war with the aelfir, and are forbidden from entering the city of Spire; many have gone into hiding in the City Beneath. The gnollish empire (and its capital city Al’Marah) is founded on their advanced demonological and mechanical abilities; there are tales of djinn being bound into brass spheres to power uncanny devices. In the confines of the Heart, where the gaps between realities are thin, they can achieve unthought-of results in mechanoccultism – and great machines from ages past thrum and whirr in the hidden depths, just waiting to be found. Gnolls have a reputation for being angry, bestial warriors – but a lot of this is propaganda on the part of the aelfir, and they’re no more warlike than any other people. Some gnolls try to use their public image to their advantage and cultivate fearsome visages, but the majority are keen to be left to their own devices.
gnoll.question.0: You travelled to the Heart in search of something specific. Were you part of a team, or were you on your own – and did you find what you were looking for?
gnoll.question.1: You fled Spire – you were an escaped prisoner of war, a refugee or an agent on a clandestine mission. What do you miss most about the surface world?
gnoll.question.2: You were born down here. What image do you project to impress, surprise or intimidate people?
